intro: Lortia major, commonly known as the large lortia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its attractive, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with opposite, ovate leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or red, with five petals and a prominent corona, making it a popular ornamental plant. Lortia major thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade in its natural habitat.
